New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam, breaking a tie in the sixth inning.
New York Mets reached the National League Championship Series for the first time in 24 years.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's grand slam was a turning point in the game.
Edwin Diaz ended the game with a critical strikeout of Kyle Schwarber.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets celebrated their first playoff win at Citi Field with a champagne celebration.
The Phillies' playoff exit came after a strong regular season with 95 wins.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the Mets' first playoff series win since 2009.
Bryce Harper and the Phillies were looking for their third World Series title.
